alert.note: Alert for Central Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 16 at 1:05PM CST until January 18 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Illinois... Des Plaines River at Riverside affecting Central Cook zone. For the Des Plaines River...including Riverside...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Des Plaines River from near Riverside to near Lyons. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Low-lying areas along the river may flood, including forest preserve and park land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM CST Tuesday, river gauges indicated a developing ice jam located on the Des Plaines River near Riverside and Lyons. The river gauge at Riverside indicated a stage of 6.9 feet. - Forecast...Water levels may continue to rise as ice accumulates on the ice jam. Flooding of overbank areas along the river is possible by later today. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along the Des Plaines River should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. An ice jam is affecting water levels in this area. River forecasts during ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday morning at 715 AM CST.
